column4: hey, why does apt-cache find 'z80asm' when i search for 'gameboy'. The manpage doesn't contain any thing regarding gameboys, and the assembler is not compatible with the Gameboy CPU

The Z80 microprocessor is used in old home computers, such as the ZX spectrum and MSX, and in several newer devices, such as the TI-83 graphical calculator and (a stripped down version) in the (original) GameBoy.
2011-02-13T23:22:00.000Z	PrototypeX29A	Pici	well the description is wrong, and iritating
2011-02-13T23:27:00.000Z	bc81	PrototypeX29A	perhaps filea bug @ launchpad?  https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/z80asm
